intro: Coscinium maingayi, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by orange-red berries that contain toxic seeds. It is often found in moist forested areas and is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical studies.
